intro: Anemia aspera, commonly known as the rough anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anemia aspera is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
